title: #5: The Woman Wonder
body:
We’re back with more Carol goodness! Join us for a discussion of the supervillain career of Kerwin Korman, the physics of tachyon blasts, the relationship between Carol and Mary Jane, sidebars on 1980s Hawkeye, and caves in Florida! Also, the eternal question: what’s the deal with Mike Barnett? All this and more in Ms. Marvel #2!


Check out this episode!

summary: An Origin Worthy of Carol Danvers In The Life Of Captain Marvel #5
title: An Origin Worthy of Carol Danvers In The Life Of Captain Marvel #5
body:
An Origin Worthy of Carol Danvers In The Life Of Captain Marvel #5

[*Mild Spoilers Ahead!]

Captain Marvel reflects on her time spent flying for NASA as well as her wingman, Walter Lawson. In the present, Carol and her mother, Mari-Ell of the Kree, are under attack by the Kree Kleaner, sent by the Kree Empress Pam’a. The Kleaner has a hold of Carol’s sister, Joe Jr., and Carol and Mari-Ell will do whatever it takes to stop the Kleaner and save their family.

The…

blog.name: davidmann95
blog.title: Not Even 50% Of My TRUE Power
blog.description: Comics guy, writer guy, Superman guy

summary: Between Shazam! #1 and the original JL backups, do you think Johns has evolved in his characterization of Billy Batson? I...
question: Between Shazam! #1 and the original JL backups, do you think Johns has evolved in his characterization of Billy Batson? I noticed there was a substantial overhaul in the new solo series that writes Billy as less of a brat, so to speak. Is Johns moving away from the dark, edgelord depiction he renewed the character with?
answer: Seemingly? It doesn’t seem like character growth, it seems like a different tack entirely; I’d guess the movie is rightly taking a different route than what he originally outlined and he’s trying to get it spiritually in line with that while adhering to the basics of his revision.

reblog.comment: Seemingly? It doesn’t seem like character growth, it seems like a different tack entirely; I’d guess the movie is rightly taking a different route than what he originally outlined and he’s trying to get it spiritually in line with that while adhering to the basics of his revision.

trail.content_raw: Seemingly? It doesn’t seem like character growth, it seems like a different tack entirely; I’d guess the movie is rightly taking a different route than what he originally outlined and he’s trying to get it spiritually in line with that while adhering to the basics of his revision.
trail.content: Seemingly? It doesn’t seem like character growth, it seems like a different tack entirely; I’d guess the movie is rightly taking a different route than what he originally outlined and he’s trying to get it spiritually in line with that while adhering to the basics of his revision.

blog.name: originaljediinjeans
blog.title: One Wandering Jedi
blog.description:
Yes, it hurt when I fell from heaven, meaning when Order 66 happened and I had to leave my home galaxy.
IRL: I am a member of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day saints. I'm a cosplayer, a fangirl, an artist, and a dreamer. Top fandoms: Star Wars, Harry Potter, MCU/Avengers, Lord of the Rings. My favorite Disney princess is Mira Nova. I'm also madly in love with Bucky Barnes. In case you haven't figured it out by now, I'm autistic.

summary: needs to happen in Endgame but not likely: one of the Avengers is trying to track down Nick Fury and Maria Hill’s last...
body:
needs to happen in Endgame but not likely: one of the Avengers is trying to track down Nick Fury and Maria Hill’s last whereabouts (probably not an easy task, maybe Nat would know how to locate them). But when they get to the city street where they were at, somewhere in a pile of debris they find the pager. Chances are, they don’t know what it is but somehow sense it is important and/or tied to Fury. They take it back to the other Avengers, they try to figure it out. It’s a piece of 90s tech that has been updated with…something. (Rocket Raccoon is from Outer Space, maybe he can tell how the pager has been modified) Maybe they figured out that it was used right before Fury got dusted, but they can’t trace the contact.   And then Carol Danvers pops out of thin air and she’s like, “Who are you guys and where is Fury?” 

(”Well, that answers our question”, someone says, most likely Bruce or Rocket)
